content: #282 gathering hat designed by kate salomon whether your autumn days are spent among a gathering of friends for pick-up football games or gathering the last of the summer s bounty for preserving a hefty hat can protect from brisk winds and cold ears giving us a bit more time outdoors to enjoy the best of the season finished measurements one size fits most adults - 18 / 45cm circumference and 8 ½ / 21cm deep gauge 15 sts and 24 row = 4 /10 cm in slipped stitch rib materials yarn 1 skein yarn over needles us size 10 / 6mm 16 circular needle or dpn s or preferred length for magic loop glossary sl1 = slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in back cdd = centered double decrease slip 2 sts as if to knit them together to your right needle knit 1 pass both slipped sts over the knit st and off the needle casting them off 2 sts decreased ptbl = purl through the back loop of st instructions cast on 70 stitches with your preferred stretchy method i recommend the german twist row 1 k1 p1 repeat to the end of the row row 2 sl 1 p1 repeat to the end of the row repeat these two row a total of 11 times 22 row or until desired depth has been reached the decrease section of the pattern is approx 5 inches deep work the decrease chart from row 3 24 until 10 sts remain changing needles as needed to work the smaller circumference break yarn leaving tail thread yarn onto darning needle and gently pull through remaining 10 sts closing the gap begin here for hat decreases repeat these 2 row 11x s finishing weave ends in on wrong side your project will be softer and more beautiful after a gentle washing by hand in warm water and a mild soap ordetergent then roll in a towel to remove excess moisture or spin dry in a washing machine for 10 seconds only lay flat to dry in a well-ventilated area block if necessary green mountain spinnery 7 brickyard ln putney vermont 05346-0568 phone 802 387 4528 fax 802 387 4841 email spinnery@spinnery com ©copyright green mountain spinnery increase 2019 www spinnery com 800 321 9665
